alert.note: Alert for Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Middlesex; New Kent (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 17 at 5:41PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Middlesex, southeastern King and Queen, central New Kent and southeastern King William Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 541 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near New Kent, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... New Kent, King William, West Point, King And Queen Court House, Church View, Little Plymouth, Shacklefords, Eltham, Cohoke, Dragonville, Gressit, Rose Garden, Mattaponi, Lanesville, Palls, Mascot, Cooke, Velma, Romancoke and Plum Point. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.

area.areaDesc: Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Middlesex; New Kent
